longTitle.p: To establish the Digital Financial Center Zone, to provide for the governance and regulation of digital financial services within the Zone, to establish a framework for programmable compliance and smart asset operations, and for connected purposes.

preface.p: BE IT ENACTED by the Parliament as follows:

content.p: This Act may be cited as the Digital Financial Center Zone Act 2025.
This Act shall come into force on such date as the Minister may, by order published in the Gazette, appoint.

intro.p: In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires—

content.p: "Zone Authority" means the Digital Financial Center Zone Authority established under section 5;
"Registered Entity" means a legal entity registered under Part III to conduct business within the Zone;
There is hereby established a special economic zone to be known as the Digital Financial Center Zone (hereinafter "the Zone").
The Zone shall have its own legal and regulatory framework as provided in this Act and regulations made thereunder.

The Zone shall comprise—
(a)
the physical premises designated by the Minister by order;
(b)
digital infrastructure operated by or on behalf of the Zone Authority; and
(c)
Smart Assets registered under Part IV, regardless of their physical location.
There is hereby established a body corporate to be known as the Digital Financial Center Zone Authority.
The Zone Authority shall have perpetual succession and a common seal and may sue and be sued in its corporate name.
No person shall conduct regulated activities within the Zone unless registered as a Registered Entity under this Part.

An application for registration shall be made to the Zone Authority 
            in such form and manner as may be prescribed, and shall include—
              
                
(a)
the applicant's constitutional documents;
                
(b)
evidence of beneficial ownership;
                
(c)
a description of proposed activities;
                
(d)
evidence of adequate capitalization;
                
(e)
a compliance program satisfying RegPack requirements; and
                
(f)
such other information as the Zone Authority may require.
A Smart Asset registered under this Part shall be recognized as valid and enforceable within the Zone.
The receipt chain of a Smart Asset shall constitute prima facie evidence of the transactions and state transitions recorded therein.

A Smart Asset shall not be registered unless—
              
                
(a)
it conforms to the MASS Protocol specification;
                
(b)
its genesis document identifies a valid issuer;
                
(c)
it is bound to one or more approved Settlement Corridors;
                
(d)
its operational manifest references an approved RegPack; and
                
(e)
the issuer has completed sanctions screening.
A Smart Asset may be configured to respond autonomously to environmental triggers in accordance with its operational manifest.
Agentic execution shall be deterministic, auditable, and subject to the policies defined in the Smart Asset's manifest.

Standard agentic policies shall include—
                
                  
(a)
automatic halt on sanctions match;
                  
(b)
automatic halt on license suspension;
                  
(c)
automatic checkpointing at defined thresholds; and
                  
(d)
automatic enforcement of arbitration rulings.
Disputes arising from Zone activities shall be resolved by arbitration in accordance with the rules of an approved arbitration institution.

The following arbitration institutions are approved—
                
                  
(a)
DIFC-LCIA Arbitration Centre;
                  
(b)
Singapore International Arbitration Centre (SIAC);
                  
(c)
AIFC International Arbitration Centre; and
                  
(d)
such other institutions as the Zone Authority may approve.

An arbitration award against a Smart Asset may be enforced automatically through the agentic execution framework where the award is cryptographically signed and the Smart Asset's manifest includes the ruling_auto_enforce policy.

All Registered Entities and Smart Assets shall comply with—
              
                
(a)
sanctions lists maintained in the Zone's RegPack;
                
(b)
OFAC Specially Designated Nationals List;
                
(c)
EU Consolidated Sanctions List;
                
(d)
UN Security Council Consolidated List; and
                
(e)
such other sanctions regimes as may be prescribed.
Smart Assets configured with agentic policies shall automatically halt operations upon detection of a sanctions match, pending resolution by the Zone Authority.
The Minister may, on the recommendation of the Zone Authority, make regulations for the better carrying out of the provisions and purposes of this Act.
The Minister may, by order, make such savings and transitional provisions as may be necessary for bringing this Act into operation.

conclusions.p: Passed by Parliament on the [DATE] day of [MONTH], 2025.
